content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, You are provided a markdown document `md` with julia language code blocks. Write a function `extract_julia_code` that extracts all the code blocks, removes code fences and joins the code blocks (if there are multiple) together with a newline. Return a String. Do not provide any examples.

```julia
function extract_julia_code(md::String)
    # Define a regular expression to match Julia code blocks
    julia_code_block = r"^ *```julia\n([\s\S]+?)\n``` *$"m

    # Initialize an empty string to store the extracted code
    output = ""

    # Loop over all matches of the regular expression in the markdown document
    for match in eachmatch(julia_code_block, md)
        # Get the captured group (the actual code block content) from the match
        code_block = match.captures[1]

        # Remove the leading and trailing whitespace from the code block
        clean_code_block = replace(code_block, r"^\s+|\s+$" => "")

        # Append the clean code block to the output string with a newline character
        output *= "\n" * clean_code_block
    end

    return output
end
```

To use this function, simply call `extract_julia_code(your_markdown_document)` and it will return the extracted Julia code as a string.
